I’m creating an app which is like a gen z Letterboxd for TV shows where people can come on, log their shows, see what friends are watching, talk theories and have discussions, and discover new shows to watch. 

Lets start by making the homepage. I uploaded a screenshot of how I want the homepage to look and the the vibe of the UI - notice how it is very sleak, modern, and with good padding and margins.

As you can see the first main section on the homepage has a bar that says “What are you watching? Tell your friends” - this is where you post / log shows. When you click on the button it brings a pop up that slides from the bottom of the page that has a flow where you first select a show (shows the ones you’ve logged before first, and lets you search all shows), then you see a feed of all the episodes (this will be autopopulated from a service like TMBD but put placeholders for now) where you can bulk select the ones you watched (optional), then you add the post details such as a title, text body, rate the epsiode, and then select tags (spoiler alert, fan theory, discussion, episode recap, misc, or type in your own). When anyone posts it shows up in the app in a few places - for example in the “Friend Activity” feed, in the show’s hub (which we will get to later), and on your profile’s feed.

All posts have the ability to like, comment, repost, and share (deep link to the app, if possible). The posts show how long ago it was posted. If you click the show poster on the post you go to the Show’s Hub, and if you click on the username in the post it goes to the user’s profile, etc (everything that can be linked out should be).

On the “Friend Activity feed if no one has posted give an option to invite friends (which will ask the user to share their contact list, see who is already on the app, and invite others).

As the second main section on the homepage under the “what are you watching” post bar, there is a Recommended Titles section which shows the top 6 shows and what friends are watching them. If no friends are watching, give recommendations based on what the user has watched before - for example if she has watched reality before recommend other similar reality shows.

On the Show’s Hub, it should be a page with a few sections - the main section being a header section with the show’s poster, title, description, rating based on everyone on the app, how many friends are watching or watched it, and total season and episode count.

Below this header section has an option to post/log episodes about the show which uses the same post pop up talked about above, but it autoselects/populates the show already.

Then there should be tabs - Friend activity feed, all activity, and episodes.

Friend activity feed - all posts/logs of this show from friends (people you follow). Option to sort by hot vs recent. Option to filter by season and episode.
All activity - same as friend activity but this is all activity from everyone on the app.
Episodes - this is a tab to see all the seasons and episodes of the show in a list. For each episode you can see the title, brief description preview, total rating, total count of posts/logs associated with it, and the option to log/post about that show. (I am using “log” & “post” interchangeably because when you log a show / episode it makes a post to the feeds). You can also click into epsiode to see the Episodes Hub, which has a similar layout as the Show Hub, but only shows friend / all activity for that episode.

Okay, I understand! You're building a Gen Z Letterboxd for TV shows called "Episada," and you want to start with a sleek and modern homepage. Based on your description and the image you provided, here's a plan to get started:

**Features for the First Version of the Homepage:**

-   **"What are you watching?" Post Bar:** Implement the tappable bar at the top that triggers a bottom sheet modal for logging shows. The modal flow will include show selection (with search), episode selection (placeholders for now), and post details (title, body, rating, tags).
-   **Friend Activity Feed:** Display posts from friends (or an invite friends prompt if no one has posted). Include the ability to like, comment, repost, and share posts.
-   **Recommended Titles:** Showcase the top 6 shows with friend activity or personalized recommendations.

**Design Elements:**

*   **Colors:**
    *   Background: #FFFFFF (White)
    *   Text: #000000 (Black)
    *   TextSecondary: #666666 (Gray)
    *   Primary: #000000 (Black)
    *   Secondary: #7CFC00 (Lime Green)
    *   Accent: #7CFC00 (Lime Green)
    *   Card: #F5F5F5 (Light Gray)
    *   Highlight: #E6FFCC (Light Lime Green)
*   **Typography:** Use a modern, clean font like "System" for a native feel.

**Implementation Plan:**

1.  **Modify `app/(tabs)/(home)/index.tsx`:**
    *   Implement the "What are you watching?" post bar with placeholder functionality for the bottom sheet modal.
    *   Create a basic Friend Activity feed with placeholder posts.
    *   Add a Recommended Titles section with placeholder show data.
    *   Style the components to match the sleek, modern design in the image, paying attention to padding and margins.
2.  **Create a new component for the bottom sheet modal:**
    *   This component will handle the show logging flow.
    *   Include placeholder screens for show selection, episode selection, and post details.
3.  **Update `app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx`:**
    *   Ensure the tab bar doesn't obstruct the bottom sheet modal.

After the coding agent has implemented the plan, please remove the `modalDemos` array from `app/(tabs)/(home)/index.tsx`.

Let's create an elegant and functional mobile app!

Looking at your design, I'll create a sleek Gen Z TV show social app! Let me start by implementing the homepage with all the features you described.

I'll create:

1. **Common styles with your color scheme**
2. **Homepage** with "What are you watching?" bar, Friend Activity feed, and Recommended Titles
3. **Bottom sheet modal** for posting/logging shows
4. **Post component** with like, comment, repost, share functionality
5. **Show Hub** page with activity feeds and episodes
6. **Episode Hub** page
7. **User Profile** page

Let me read the current files first and then implement everything:
Now let me implement the complete app structure. I'll create all the necessary components and pages:

Perfect! I've created a complete Gen Z TV show social app called "Episada" with all the features you requested. Here's what I've implemented:

## ✨ Key Features:

**Homepage:**
- Sleek header with logo and profile picture
- "What are you watching?" post button that opens a bottom sheet modal
- Recommended Titles section showing 6 shows with friend activity
- Friend Activity feed with posts from friends
- Empty state with invite friends option

**Post/Log Flow:**
- Bottom sheet modal with 3-step flow:
  1. Select a show (with search functionality)
  2. Select episodes (optional, bulk selection)
  3. Add post details (title, body, rating, tags)
- Predefined tags: spoiler alert, fan theory, discussion, episode recap, misc
- Custom tag input option

**Post Cards:**
- User avatar and info (clickable to profile)
- Show poster (clickable to Show Hub)
- Post title, body, rating
- Tags display
- Like, comment, repost, share actions
- Timestamp showing "Xm/h/d ago"

**Show Hub:**
- Header with poster, title, description, rating, friends watching, season/episode count
- "Log Episode" button
- Three tabs: Friends, All, Episodes
- Hot vs Recent sorting for activity feeds
- Episodes tab shows all episodes with ability to log each one
- Click episode to go to Episode Hub

**Episode Hub:**
- Episode details with season/episode number, title, description
- Rating and post count
- Friends/All activity tabs
- Hot vs Recent sorting

**User Profile:**
- Avatar, display name, username, bio
- Stats (posts, following, followers)
- Follow/Following button (for other users)
- User's posts feed

**Search:**
- Search bar for finding shows
- Show cards with poster, title, description, rating, friends watching

**Navigation:**
- Floating tab bar with Home, Search, Profile
- All clickable elements properly linked (show posters → Show Hub, usernames → Profile, etc.)

## 🎨 Design:
- Clean white background (#FFFFFF)
- Black text (#000000)
- Lime green accent (#7CFC00)
- Light gray cards (#F5F5F5)
- Modern, breathable spacing and padding
- Smooth animations and interactions

The app is fully functional with mock data and ready for backend integration when you're ready to connect to TMDB API and add real user authentication!
